resources.string:
The winner is the first to fill all the beds.

There are %1$d beds marked out across the board and a vertical line on each side.

Each player has a turn sliding their %2$d coins up the board with the aim of coins ending in a bed to score.

Once they have a total score of %3$d for a bed, that bed is considered filled.

At the end of a player\'s turn, any valid scores are added to that player\'s score for the bed.

If the bed has already been filled, that bed\'s scores will go to the opponent (unless doing so would cause a win).

A coin that does not reach the first bed may be replayed.

Coins that strike the sides will %4$s off the edge.

Coins crossing the side rails will %5$s valid for scoring.
